newsitem.title: CHINA: Cosmos issues warrants with share rights.
newsitem.headline: Cosmos issues warrants with share rights.

text.p: Cosmos Machinery Enterprises Ltd will issue warrants attached with rights to subscribe for new shares, which together would raise HK$322 million for general working capital, the company said on Wednesday.
Trading in the machinery distributor and distilled water bottler's shares, suspended on Tuesday pending an announcement, will resume on Wednesday.

Cosmos Machinery intends to raise about HK$29.3 million before expenses by way of an issue of 122.09 million warrants at HK$0.24 each, attached with the right to subscribe for ordinary shares, a company statement published on Wednesday said.

On the exercise of the subscription rights at an initial subscription price of HK$2.40 for each new share, about 122.09 million shares will be issued representing about 20 percent of the existing issued share capital and about 16.67 percent of the enlarged issued share capital, the statement said.
Assuming the subscription rights attached to the warrants are subscribed in full, the company will receive HK$293 million in addition to the HK$29.3 million from the warrants, it said.
